If they are beaten, touched, disturbed, or harmed by evil beings, they should all endure it, and should not abandon any being, without regret in their hearts, without sorrow or distress, and should diligently apply themselves to disciplining beings.

'The Great Vehicle is in conflict with the world.'
Why is this?
All beings go with the flow of birth and death, while the Dharma of the Great Vehicle goes against the flow of birth and death;
All beings each have their own disputes, while the Dharma of the Great Vehicle breaks down disputes;
The Dharma of the Great Vehicle extinguishes the mind of anger;
All beings each have their own deceptions, while the Dharma of the Great Vehicle is straightforward and without deception.
In the worlds of the ten directions, if there are beings who follow the Bodhisattva with various weapons, and say:

The bodhisattva, hearing this, will never turn back from the mind of enlightenment, and will not abandon loving-kindness, compassion, joy, equanimity, generosity, morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom.
Why is this?
The bodhisattva thinks:
'In the immeasurable and boundless worlds, I have experienced the bodies of the great hells, animals, hungry ghosts, humans, and gods, and practiced evil dharmas, unable to benefit myself or others.
If in the immeasurable worlds, I am pursued by those evil people with knives and sticks, and my body is cut up into pieces, I will never abandon the mind of enlightenment and all sentient beings.
Why is this?
If I am unable to endure such suffering in the world, how can I bear the sufferings of the hells?
When practicing good dharmas, there are often evil dharmas that come to create obstacles. If I do not endure them, how can I practice various good dharmas?
All sentient beings give me evil things, but I will give them good dharmas in return;
Sentient beings give me knives, sticks, and insults, but I give them the unsurpassed great forbearance.
